page.title: 01Landscape and buildings
page.content: The fields around Hawkchurch are mostly grazing fields. There are a lot of cattle. The wildlife is mostly nocturnal; animals like badgers, foxes, rabbits, shrews and moles. The houses are very old and most of them have thatched roofs and the building material is not brick but stone.There are a few fields used for grazing sheep and horses.Some farms have poultry. In the village the most important buildings are the post-office, the church, the pub and there is a village cross in memory of the first world war.
